metadata.title: USN-6401-1 -- FreeRDP vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that FreeRDP did not properly manage certain inputs. A malicious server could use this issue to cause FreeRDP clients to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive  information. (CVE-2023-39350, CVE-2023-39351,  CVE-2023-39353,  CVE-2023-39354, CVE-2023-40181, CVE-2023-40188, CVE-2023-40589)  It was discovered that FreeRDP did not properly manage certain inputs. A malicious server could use this issue to cause FreeRDP clients to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2023-40186, CVE-2023-40567, CVE-2023-40569)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6401-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libfreerdp2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 freerdp2-dev - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 freerdp2-wayland - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libwinpr2-dev - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libuwac0-0 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 freerdp2-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libwinpr2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libuwac0-dev - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 winpr-utils - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.4 No subscription required
